qas.question: What is the former Cameroon pavilion?

answers.text: The Pagode de Vincennes Buddhist temple

qas.question: Where is the biggest Buddha statue in Europe?

answers.text: The Pagode de Vincennes Buddhist temple

qas.question: How tall is the biggest Buddha statue in Europe?
When did the Hindu temple on Rue Pajol open?

context: <a0_0><a1_0>The Pagode de Vincennes Buddhist temple<a1_0/><a0_0/>, near Lake Daumesnil in the Bois de Vincennes, is the former Cameroon pavilion from the 1931 Paris Colonial Exposition. It hosts several different schools of Buddhism, and does not have a single leader. It shelters the biggest Buddha statue in Europe, <a2_0>more than nine metres high<a2_0/>. There are two other small temples located in the Asian community in the 13th arrondissement. A Hindu temple, dedicated to Ganesh, on Rue Pajol in the 18th arrondissement, opened in <a3_0>1985<a3_0/>.
